decision_conditions: The mature Monterey Cypress (T39) is situated on the southwestern corner of the property in the front garden.

The Monterey Cypress is approximately 18m tall, has a crown spread of Approximately 9m and stands about 20m away from the main property. This tree has a moderate amenity value and is highly visible from the south, east and west - making an important contribution to the visual amenity and arboreal character of the local area. It is also a member of a group of two mature trees - making a good contribution to the arboricultural cohesion here.

The reasons given are not considered to be justified reasons for the removal of this tree. Furthermore, the proposed work may well set an undesirable precedent for felling other large, mature trees in the area, which would also be detrimental to the longer-term visual amenity and arboreal character of the area.
Conclusion: Having regard to the reasons given for the proposed work, the removal of this mature tree is not considered to be ju
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
description: To fell and replace with a Silver Birch, one Monterey Cypress, T39 on TPO 281.
